claim: Recombinant HA antigens produced using BEVS have been shown to induce significantly higher levels of broadly cross-reactive antibodies against highly conserved regions of HA compared with egg-derived vaccines.

rejected_evidence.quote: because it is not subject to mutations to the A (H3 N2) glycosylation binding site that reduce the effectiveness of egg based vaccines.
rejected_evidence.original_explanation: This statement directly addresses a key mechanism by which recombinant HA antigens produced using BEVS (such as RIV4) differ from egg-derived vaccines, supporting the claim that BEVS-produced antigens can induce broader and more effective immune responses due to the absence of egg-adaptive mutations.
